pullRequest.body:
Establishes locality properties of meromorphic functions in normal form, analogous to existing statements for analytic functions. Establishes that meromorphic functions have normal form outside of a codiscrete set. Describes the vanishing locus in terms of the order function. Establishes elementary criteria to guarantee normal form.

**Caveat Emptor!** This PR re-installs a theorem `AnalyticAt.eventuallyEq_nhdNE_iff_eventuallyEq_nhd` that was previously criticised by reviewers. It adds an analogous theorem `MeromorphicNFAt.eventuallyEq_nhdNE_iff_eventuallyEq_nhd` for meromorphic functions in normal form. The reason for bringing these theorems back is that they are used throughout [Project VD](https://github.com/kebekus/ProjectVD), which aims to formalize Value Distribution Theory for meromorphic functions on the complex plane. I will bring the issue up on [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/API.20for.20continuous.20extension.20of.20meromorphic.20functions) and downgrade the PR to "draft" while the discussion is going.

---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Note that mathlib requires that all *definitions* come with a docstring. Theorems/lemmas do not have to be documented, but it is fine to do so if the docstring helps understanding the statement (or provides a reference, etc...).
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
    {g : ùïú ‚Üí ùïú} {f : ùïú ‚Üí E} {z‚ÇÄ : ùïú} (h‚ÇÅg : AnalyticAt ùïú g z‚ÇÄ) (h‚ÇÇg : g z‚ÇÄ ‚â† 0) :
```
Are you putting `g` before `f` on purpose?
I put `g` first because the statement talks about `g ‚Ä¢ f`. But I really have no strong opinion here and I am happy to flip the two.

I think `f`, `g`, and `z‚ÇÄ` can be turned into `variable`s. The case where you need `f : ùïú ‚Üí ùïú` could either be done by shadowing `f` in the statement, or by also adding a variable `phi`(?) of that type.

So is this true as
```suggestion
theorem eventuallyEq_nhdNE_iff_eventuallyEq_nhd (hf : ContinuousAt f z‚ÇÄ) (hg : ContinuousAt g z‚ÇÄ) :
```
?
Can't you more generally prove that `WithTop.map n = 0 \iff n = 0` for `n : ENat`?

pullRequest.title: feat: elementary properties of meromorphic functions in normal form
